Date: Feb 1, 2023
Location:
Israel, Petach Tikva
Job Category: Education Services
Department: Customer Success
Who we are:
CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), the global leader in Identity Security, Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets

What will you do:
The CyberArk Knowledge & Community team strives to deliver relevant information to the right people at the right time through our content, tools, and processes. We foster a dynamic community with over 12,000 monthly unique member logins and are dedicated to producing high-quality, engaging, and accessible content that boosts confidence and engagement with CyberArk's products.

Our team serves as a primary point of contact for technical customers and partners and thereby plays a key role in driving positive outcomes both internally and externally.
With such a crucial role and a large user base, there’s never a dull moment as our work environment is fast paced, constantly evolving, and includes a diverse range of projects.

Activities may include some or all of the following:
Interact with Technical Community members by responding to questions and comments, addressing flagged items, and maintaining a supportive and positive environment.
Create reports and dashboards to track key metrics related to knowledge and community and use data insights to suggest areas for improvement.
Monitor and analyse usage metrics such as search queries and content consumption to continually optimize the knowledge management system.
Assist in the design, development, testing, and implementation of knowledge management systems, processes, and workflows.
Collect, organize, and curate technical content from internal and external sources to ensure relevant and engaging content is available to the community.
Collaborate with other community team members to plan, execute, and manage community initiatives and projects.

What you need to succeed:

Educational Background: Currently pursuing a degree in a related field such as Industrial Engineering, Information Systems, Marketing, Communications, Cybersecurity, or Computer Science.
Technical Understanding: Proficiency in technical concepts with the ability to clearly explain complex ideas.
Analytical Ability: Skilled in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to make informed decisions.
Strong Communication: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Customer Focus: Able to think from the customer's perspective to ensure community and knowledge management initiatives meet their needs.
Self-motivated and Team-oriented: Able to handle multiple tasks and prioritize time effectively, while also being a strong team player.
Passion for Technology and Security: Enthusiastic about software, technology, and security.
Excellent English: Fluent in spoken and written English.

How will you stand out from the crowd:
Relevant work experience or relevant coursework in the areas of community management, knowledge management, or information management.
Strong skills in data analysis and visualizing insights, with the ability to turn data into actionable insights.
Familiarity with knowledge management tools and technologies, such as content management systems, customer relationship management (CRM) software, or analytics platforms.

To learn more about CyberArk, visit https://www.cyberark.com, read the CyberArk blogs or follow on Twitter via @CyberArk, LinkedIn or Facebook.

Application Specialist is the entry level position at Alpha Omega. The Application Specialist’s primary responsibility is maintaining customer and distributor satisfaction and to assist in implementing Alpha Omega technology into their practice by providing clinical surgery support, neuroscience support, performing routine inspections on Alpha Omega equipment, and proactively addressing any customer needs. Success in this role is driven by the employee’s ability to handle case support, solve technical issues, and keep accurate records independently without constant supervision. This role reports to the Marketing manager and may be asked to perform other tasks to reach revenue quotas or maintain customer satisfaction as the Clinical and Research Product Development Manager deems necessary.

Responsibilities
Perform Clinical case support
Perform installation and training at customer site (clinical and research)
Assist in demos
Perform equipment preventative maintenance
Achieve regional support revenue quota
Assist in achieving regional revenue targets

Qualifications

student of Bachelors or higher degree in Neuroscience, Biomedical Engineering or Life Sciences
Excellent communication skills
Ability to lift 50+ lbs. and stand for long hours in the operating room
Ability to travel
High level of English- a mustShow more Report

job: Sales Engineering / Account Management Intern – Ra'anana near Tel Aviv, Israel
description:
We can't predict what the future holds, but we know Texas Instruments will have a part in shaping it.
Are you an early technology adopter and want a glimpse of the latest products before anyone else? A Technical Sales Engineer internship may be a fit for you. Combine your technical skills with selling and marketing skills to help our customers solve their most challenging problems, and to develop and deliver innovative solutions across various end equipments. Technical Sales Engineers at TI work directly with customers to ensure TI technologies are in the world’s next-generation innovations.

Technical Sales Engineer Intern responsibilities include:
Gain hands-on experience in one of our Field Sales Offices (FSO) learning the Technical Sales Engineer role and how we conduct business with our customers
Learn how our Technical Sales force engages with TI’s business units
Work on hands-on, challenging projects and have opportunities to present your findings to leaders, including running a market analysis, customer case studies, running a project kick off, choosing high growth accounts, and making a final intern presentation
Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position.
Minimum Requirements:
Pursuing a Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering or related field
Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to effectively balance strong technical skills with solid relationship-building capabilities
Demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong written, verbal communication skills
Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people across various functions
Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery
Demonstrated ability to build strong, influential relationships
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Ability to take the initiative and drive for results
Why TI?
Engineer your future. We empower our employees to truly own their career and development. Come collaborate with some of the smartest people in the world to shape the future of electronics.
We’re different by design. Diverse backgrounds and perspectives are what push innovation forward and what make TI stronger. We value each and every voice, and look forward to hearing yours. Meet the people of TI
Benefits that benefit you. We offer competitive pay and benefits designed to help you and your family live your best life. Your well-being is important to us.
About Texas Instruments
As a global semiconductor company, we design, manufacture, test and sell analog and embedded processing chips to nearly 100,000 customers. Our products enable electronics everywhere and in things you experience every day - from health care, smart homes and connected cars to drones, smart phones and more. Our passion to create a better and more sustainable world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors drives us to make our technology smaller, more efficient, more reliable and more affordable.
Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment.

If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition.Show more Report

Looking to learn your ways in a startup environment?
At Toonimo you can achieve practical "real-life" knowledge and watch a rapidly growing startup from the inside.
We have openings from time to time in various departments in the company. We try to make everyone feel at home as possible and strive for long-term relationship with individuals in the company.
R&D - Full stack web developer

Wants to work as part of a team
Front End Developer experience
Creative, motivated and hard worker
Full stack developer experienced in all aspects of web/mobile

Developed in HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, Ajax, Backbone/angular, RequireJs
Strong “pure javascript” background - advantage
Chrome extensions knowledge - advantage
Marketing
Desired Skills:
Native American English speaker - a must!
Experience producing online content and/or social content.
Experience managing social presence and activity over multiple networks.
Outstanding communications and storytelling skills
Able to break complex concepts to simple messages.
Sales Development
Desired Skills:
Excellent communication skills
Excellent spoken and written English
Experience in SalesForce CRM - advantage
Available to work U.S. business hours
Job Description:
A dynamic sales oriented role, focused on initiating sales leads
Prospect and qualify new leads (SalesForce experience required)
Follow up on leads from marketing campaigns and conferences
Engage potential leads via phone, email and social media

Legal Intern
Date: Feb 10, 2023
Location:
Tel Aviv, Israel, 1
Company: Teva Pharmaceuticals
Job Id: 41245
Who are we?
Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!
Job Description

Teva's legal department is looking for a legal intern for august 2023.
The firm's main area of activity is providing ongoing legal support to the company's business units in the civil/commercial field.
The role consists of:
Preparation and review of contracts in English and Hebrew.
Participation in negotiation meetings.
Responding to queries with regards to existing agreements in English and Hebrew.
Conducting legal research on a wide range of topics.

The position is located in the company's offices in Tel Aviv.

Qualifications

Graduate of a law degree- university only
English and Hebrew at a very high level (mother tongue level), which includes writing ability.

Function
Legal & IP
Sub Function
Legal Support
Reports To

Sr Dir Legal Generalist II, Legal

Already Working @TEVA?

If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site
The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.
Teva’s Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment
Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment.
